positioning.headline: Your business has an AI problem. I solve it.
positioning.subheadline: I build AI agents, knowledge graphs, and intelligent platforms that actually ship to production — not slide decks.
positioning.credentialLine: 12+ years. Fortune-500 retail, telecom, media. Production AI systems.
valueProps: From strategy to production-ready code — no hand-off to juniors
Battle-tested across Fortune-500 retail, telecom, media, and e-commerce
Solo delivery or embedded in your team — your choice

solutions.title: AI Agent & Agentic Platform Development
solutions.headline: Your team is building AI demos that never ship to production
solutions.subheadline: I build production-grade AI agents and multi-agent platforms that run reliably at enterprise scale — with monitoring, guardrails, and real ops integration.
solutions.persona: VP Engineering / CTO stuck in PoC hell
painPoints: Your proof-of-concept impressed the board, but six months later it still isn't in production
The AI vendor demos look great — until you try to integrate with your actual data and systems
Your engineers are smart but nobody on the team has shipped multi-agent systems before
You're burning budget on consultants who deliver PowerPoints, not working software
solutions.definition: Agentic AI systems are autonomous software agents powered by large language models that can reason, plan, use tools, and take actions — independently or in coordinated multi-agent pipelines. Unlike simple chatbots, production AI agents integrate with real enterprise systems, handle edge cases gracefully, and operate under monitoring and governance frameworks.

approach.description: Map your current systems, data sources, and the specific workflows you want to automate. No generic assessments — I focus on what will move the needle.
Design the agent topology, tool integrations, monitoring hooks, and guardrails. You get a concrete architecture document, not a vague roadmap.
Hands-on development of the agent pipeline, integration with your existing stack, and deployment to your infrastructure.
Knowledge transfer, documentation, and monitoring setup so your team can operate and extend the system independently.

outcomes: Production-grade AI agents running on your infrastructure — not demo notebooks
Multi-agent orchestration with Langflow, OpenWebUI, or custom pipelines
Integrated monitoring via Grafana/Prometheus with anomaly alerting
Your team trained to maintain and extend the system

faqs.question: How long does it take to go from PoC to production?
faqs.answer: A focused PoC takes 4-6 weeks. Production deployment with monitoring, guardrails, and testing typically takes 8-14 weeks depending on integration complexity.

faqs.question: Do you work with our existing tech stack or bring your own?
faqs.answer: I adapt to your stack. Whether you're on AWS, Azure, or GCP, using Python or TypeScript, I integrate with what you have rather than forcing a rewrite.

faqs.question: What happens after the engagement ends?
faqs.answer: You get full ownership of the code, documentation, and architecture decisions. I do a structured knowledge transfer so your team can operate and extend the system independently.

faqs.question: Can you work embedded in our team?
faqs.answer: Yes. I regularly embed as a tech lead within client teams, participating in standups, code reviews, and sprint planning while driving the AI agent architecture forward.

solutions.seoTitle: AI Agent Development | Production-Ready Agentic AI Systems
solutions.seoDescription: Ship AI agents to production, not PowerPoints. I build enterprise-grade multi-agent systems with monitoring, guardrails, and real ops integration. 12+ years experience.

solutions.title: Knowledge Graph & GraphRAG Implementation
solutions.headline: Your knowledge base answers are wrong half the time
solutions.subheadline: I build GraphRAG systems that actually understand your domain — connecting articles, products, and processes into a knowledge graph your LLMs can reason over.
solutions.persona: Product / Knowledge Manager drowning in stale docs
painPoints: Your internal search returns irrelevant results because it can't understand relationships between concepts
Customer-facing articles are outdated, duplicated, or contradictory — and nobody knows which ones to trust
You tried basic RAG but the answers lack context and miss connections across your knowledge base
Quality auditing tens of thousands of articles manually is impossible — you need automated signals
solutions.definition: GraphRAG combines knowledge graph technology with retrieval-augmented generation to enable LLMs to traverse structured relationships between entities — delivering more accurate, contextually rich answers than traditional vector-based RAG. It excels in enterprise knowledge bases with complex domain ontologies, multi-product portfolios, and cross-referencing requirements.

approach.description: Map your domain's entities, relationships, and quality signals into a custom ontology — not a generic template, but one built from your actual content structure.
Build the knowledge graph in Neo4j with automated ingestion, quality metrics per article (duplication score, relevance, readability), and entity linking.
Implement multi-hop reasoning agents that traverse the graph to answer complex queries, suggest improvements, and generate new content from verified knowledge.
Interactive graph visualization for stakeholders, quality dashboards, and full documentation for your team to maintain the system.

outcomes: Knowledge graph connecting tens of thousands of articles with automated quality scoring
Multi-hop reasoning LLM agent answering complex cross-domain queries
Automated quality metrics: duplication detection, relevance scoring, readability index, translation gap analysis
Interactive knowledge graph visualization with multi-dimensional filtering

faqs.question: How is GraphRAG different from regular RAG?
faqs.answer: Traditional RAG retrieves text chunks by vector similarity. GraphRAG structures your knowledge into a graph of entities and relationships, then uses multi-hop traversal to find answers that require connecting information across multiple documents.

faqs.question: What size knowledge base does this work for?
faqs.answer: I've built systems for knowledge bases with tens of thousands of articles. The approach scales well because the graph structure makes retrieval more precise as the corpus grows.

faqs.question: Can this work with our existing Salesforce/Confluence/SharePoint knowledge base?
faqs.answer: Yes. I build automated ingestion pipelines from common knowledge base platforms. The graph is built from your existing content — no manual migration required.

faqs.question: How do you measure knowledge quality?
faqs.answer: Each article gets automated quality scores: duplication detection, product relevance, readability index, and translation gap analysis. These surface which content needs attention without manual review.

solutions.seoTitle: GraphRAG Implementation | Knowledge Graph & AI Search Solutions
solutions.seoDescription: Turn your messy knowledge base into a structured knowledge graph with AI-powered search. GraphRAG, Neo4j, multi-hop reasoning agents. Solo-architected for enterprises.

solutions.title: AI-Powered E-commerce Architecture
solutions.headline: Your storefront conversion hasn't improved since you launched
solutions.subheadline: I architect headless commerce platforms with intelligent search, personalization, and AI-driven optimization — built for speed, scale, and multi-brand portfolios.
painPoints: Your monolithic e-commerce platform is too slow and too rigid for the personalization your customers expect
Adding a second brand or market takes 6-12 months because everything is hardcoded for brand one
Your search returns irrelevant products and your recommendation engine is barely better than random
You know AI could improve conversions but your current architecture can't support it without a major rewrite
solutions.definition: AI-powered e-commerce architecture combines headless commerce platforms (decoupling frontend from backend via GraphQL) with AI capabilities like intelligent product search, personalized recommendations, dynamic pricing, and predictive inventory — enabling faster page loads, better conversion rates, and effortless multi-brand scaling.

approach.description: Assess your current e-commerce stack, identify bottlenecks, and map the highest-ROI opportunities for AI integration.
Decouple your storefront from the backend with a GraphQL BFF layer, enabling independent frontend evolution and AI feature integration.
Implement intelligent search, personalized recommendations, and content automation — integrated with your existing product catalog and customer data.
Design token architecture and component library enabling rapid brand portfolio expansion — reducing new brand launches from months to weeks.

outcomes: Headless PWA storefront decoupled from backend via GraphQL — sub-second page loads
Design token architecture reducing second-brand onboarding from 9 months to 2 months (78% reduction)
CI/CD pipeline with blue/green zero-downtime deployments, cutting release cycles by 30%
AI-ready architecture supporting intelligent search, personalization, and content optimization

faqs.question: Can you work with our existing Magento/Shopify/commercetools backend?
faqs.answer: Yes. Headless architecture means decoupling the frontend from whatever commerce backend you have. I've worked extensively with Magento 2 via GraphQL and the approach adapts to Shopify, commercetools, or custom backends.

faqs.question: How long does a headless migration take?
faqs.answer: A focused MVP storefront takes 3-4 months. Full feature parity with AI capabilities typically takes 6-9 months, delivered incrementally so you see results along the way.

faqs.question: What's the ROI on headless commerce?
faqs.answer: The projects I've led have seen 78% reduction in multi-brand onboarding time and 30% faster release cycles. Page load improvements alone typically lift conversion rates 15-30%.

faqs.question: Do I need to rebuild my entire store at once?
faqs.answer: No. Headless migration can be incremental — start with the highest-impact pages (PDP, search results) and expand from there while your existing store continues to run.

solutions.seoTitle: AI E-commerce Architecture | Headless Commerce & Intelligent Storefronts
solutions.seoDescription: Architect headless e-commerce platforms with AI-powered search, personalization, and multi-brand scaling. 2.5 years building PWA storefronts for global brands.

solutions.title: AI Strategy & Fractional Technical Leadership
solutions.headline: Everyone's talking about AI but nobody on your team has built it
solutions.subheadline: I embed as your fractional AI architect — setting technical direction, evaluating opportunities, and making sure your AI investment produces real results, not just demos.
solutions.persona: CEO / Founder who needs technical leadership
painPoints: Your board is asking about your AI strategy and you don't have a credible answer yet
You've seen impressive vendor demos but have no way to evaluate which solutions actually fit your business
Your engineering team is capable but needs senior AI architecture guidance to avoid expensive wrong turns
You don't need a full-time CTO but you need someone who can make binding technical decisions
solutions.definition: Fractional AI technical leadership provides senior architecture guidance and strategic direction on a part-time or project basis — helping organizations evaluate AI opportunities, set technical direction, mentor engineering teams, and establish delivery practices without the cost and commitment of a full-time executive hire.

approach.description: Evaluate your current technical landscape, team capabilities, and business objectives to identify the highest-impact AI opportunities.
Develop a concrete AI implementation roadmap with prioritized initiatives, technology choices, and resource requirements — not a generic framework.
Guide your team through implementation with architecture reviews, code reviews, and technical decision-making support.
Mentor your engineers on AI/LLM best practices, establish SDLC disciplines, and build the internal capability to sustain the work after I step back.

outcomes: Clear AI strategy aligned with business goals — not a generic framework
Technology evaluation and vendor selection based on actual technical assessment
Engineering team mentored on AI/LLM best practices and delivery disciplines
Structured SDLC practices and delivery visibility frameworks for management

faqs.question: How many hours per week does fractional engagement typically involve?
faqs.answer: Most engagements are 2-3 days per week. This is enough to drive architecture decisions, participate in key meetings, and mentor the team without the overhead of a full-time exec.

faqs.question: Can you work remotely or do you need to be on-site?
faqs.answer: I work primarily remotely from Amsterdam with periodic on-site visits for workshops and team sessions. For European clients, on-site days are easy to arrange.

faqs.question: What's the minimum engagement length?
faqs.answer: 3 months minimum. AI strategy work needs enough runway to assess, plan, and see initial results. Most engagements run 6-12 months.

faqs.question: How is this different from hiring an AI consulting firm?
faqs.answer: You get a single senior architect who knows your codebase, team, and business context — not a rotating cast of consultants. I make technical decisions and write code, not just recommendations.

solutions.seoTitle: Fractional AI Architect | AI Strategy & Technical Leadership
solutions.seoDescription: Fractional AI technical leadership for companies building intelligent systems. Senior architecture guidance, team mentoring, and hands-on delivery. Based in Amsterdam.

solutions.title: LLM Integration & Custom AI Solutions
solutions.headline: You need LLMs in your product but don't know where to start
solutions.subheadline: I help you identify the right LLM use cases, build the integration architecture, and ship AI features your customers actually use — without the hype and without the risk.
solutions.persona: CTO / Product Lead evaluating AI integration
painPoints: You know LLMs could improve your product but the landscape of models, frameworks, and approaches is overwhelming
Your team prototyped something with the OpenAI API but it's unreliable, expensive, and not ready for production
You're worried about hallucinations, data privacy, and vendor lock-in but don't have the expertise to mitigate these risks
Every AI vendor promises magic but you need an independent technical perspective, not another sales pitch
solutions.definition: LLM integration consulting helps businesses evaluate, architect, and deploy large language model capabilities within their existing products and workflows — addressing model selection, prompt engineering, RAG pipelines, fine-tuning decisions, cost optimization, and production reliability concerns with independent, vendor-neutral guidance.

approach.description: Identify which workflows and features benefit most from LLM integration, and which are better served by traditional approaches. Not everything needs AI.
Design the integration architecture: model selection, RAG pipeline, prompt engineering strategy, caching, fallback handling, and cost controls.
Build the LLM integration into your product with proper error handling, monitoring, and guardrails against hallucination and data leakage.
Tune for cost, latency, and quality. Set up evaluation pipelines so you can measure LLM performance objectively and improve over time.

outcomes: LLM features shipping in production with proper monitoring and guardrails
Vendor-neutral architecture avoiding lock-in to any single model provider
RAG pipeline for domain-specific accuracy, reducing hallucination rates
Cost-optimized deployment with caching, model routing, and fallback strategies

faqs.question: Which LLM models do you work with?
faqs.answer: I'm model-agnostic. I work with OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, open-source models (Llama, Mistral), and enterprise solutions. The right model depends on your requirements for cost, latency, privacy, and quality.

faqs.question: How do you handle data privacy concerns?
faqs.answer: Architecture choices like self-hosted models, private API endpoints, data anonymization pipelines, and strict prompt engineering prevent sensitive data from leaking to external providers.

faqs.question: Can you integrate with our existing product without a rewrite?
faqs.answer: Yes. LLM integration is typically additive — a new API layer, a search enhancement, or a content generation pipeline that connects to your existing systems via APIs.

faqs.question: How do you prevent hallucinations?
faqs.answer: RAG grounding with verified data sources, structured output validation, confidence scoring, and human-in-the-loop review workflows. The specific approach depends on your risk tolerance and use case.

solutions.seoTitle: LLM Integration Consulting | Custom AI Solutions for Your Product
solutions.seoDescription: Ship LLM features to production with confidence. Vendor-neutral architecture, RAG pipelines, hallucination prevention, and cost optimization. Independent AI consulting.

caseStudies.title: GenAI Enablement Platform
caseStudies.challenge: A Fortune-500 global retailer needed a foundational LLM serving and agentic development platform to enable company-wide AI agent development — but the team lacked structured SDLC practices and delivery visibility.
caseStudies.approach: Embedded as tech lead in the GenAI Enablement team, driving engineering delivery and introducing planning disciplines. Contributing to a secure multi-tenant AI platform with isolated, governed agent deployments across retail and supply chain domains.
outcomes: Foundational LLM serving platform enabling company-wide AI agent development
Structured SDLC practices introduced for a team of 4 engineers
Secure multi-tenant AI platform with governed agent deployments

caseStudies.title: GraphRAG Knowledge Base
caseStudies.challenge: A legacy Salesforce knowledge base with tens of thousands of articles spanning a large product portfolio had become unreliable — outdated content, duplication, and no way to answer complex cross-domain queries.
caseStudies.approach: Solo-architected the full stack from custom domain ontology design to LLM agent deployment. Built a Neo4j knowledge graph with automated quality metrics and a multi-hop reasoning agent for complex query answering.
outcomes: Knowledge graph connecting tens of thousands of articles with automated quality scoring
Multi-hop reasoning LLM agent answering complex queries across the knowledge base
Automated quality metrics: duplication score, relevance, readability, translation gap detection
Interactive knowledge graph visualization with Sigma.js

caseStudies.title: Multi-Agent AI for Telecom
caseStudies.challenge: A large telecom operator needed AI-powered anomaly detection and root cause analysis for their network monitoring — but existing dashboards couldn't correlate events across systems or suggest resolutions.
caseStudies.approach: Built the full stack from LLM orchestration to Grafana integration and a conversational ops interface. Designed Langflow-orchestrated anomaly detection with specialized agents for identification, classification, and escalation.
outcomes: Langflow-orchestrated anomaly detection pipeline with specialized LLM agents
RAG-based knowledge base with incident history for contextual troubleshooting
Grafana integration for real-time incident alerting and reflection
OpenWebUI conversational interface for field engineer incident investigation

caseStudies.title: PWA Storefront for Global Coffee Brand
caseStudies.challenge: A global coffee brand needed a next-generation storefront to decouple from Magento 2, support multiple brands, and enable faster feature delivery — while maintaining performance for a worldwide audience.
caseStudies.approach: Co-architected a GraphCommerce-based PWA with a Next.js + TypeScript BFF layer, design token architecture for multi-brand support, and CI/CD with blue/green zero-downtime deployments.
outcomes: GraphCommerce-based PWA decoupled from Magento 2 via GraphQL
Second-brand onboarding reduced from 9 months to 2 months (78% reduction)
Release cycle time cut by 30% with blue/green zero-downtime CI/CD
6 engineers mentored across design, QA, and product teams

caseStudies.title: Multimedia Hub for Set-Top Box
caseStudies.challenge: A European telecom's set-top box platform needed unified UX across live TV, VOD, and third-party apps — but the Node.js-based embedded system had critical memory leaks and reliability issues.
caseStudies.approach: Developed EFL graphics components rendered directly from Node.js on embedded Linux hardware. Optimised memory footprint and startup time, instrumenting monitoring dashboards for proactive issue detection.
outcomes: Unified UX across live TV, VOD, and third-party apps on embedded Linux
Critical memory leaks resolved in a 400K-line codebase
On-device crash rate reduced by 25% via Prometheus/Grafana instrumentation

caseStudies.title: Editorial Tools for News Publishing
caseStudies.challenge: Sweden's second-largest news publisher needed real-time analytics dashboards and modern editorial tooling — but the legacy EPiServer CMS couldn't support the pace of digital journalism.
caseStudies.approach: Built analytics microservices with real-time competitor insights. Led the migration from EPiServer to React/Redux + Node.js and orchestrated the move to OpenShift Kubernetes.
outcomes: Real-time analytics dashboards with competitor insights for editors
Screenshot service storing 10TB+ images on Amazon S3
Deployment frequency improved 3x after Kubernetes migration

tiers.name: Advisory
tiers.description: AI readiness assessment, architecture review, technology evaluation, and an actionable implementation roadmap.

tiers.name: Implementation
tiers.description: Hands-on design and development of AI systems — agents, knowledge graphs, LLM integrations, or e-commerce platforms. Delivered incrementally with working software at every milestone.

tiers.name: Embedded
tiers.description: Ongoing technical leadership embedded in your team — architecture decisions, code reviews, mentoring, and delivery oversight. Part-time (2-3 days/week) with full context.

processSteps.name: Discovery Call
processSteps.description: 30-minute conversation to understand your challenge, timeline, and goals. No pitch — just listening.

processSteps.name: Proposal
processSteps.description: Within a week, you get a concrete proposal with scope, approach, timeline, and fixed pricing. No surprises.

processSteps.name: Build
processSteps.description: Hands-on work with regular check-ins and demos. You see working software at every milestone, not just at the end.

processSteps.name: Handoff
processSteps.description: Documentation, knowledge transfer, and a follow-up period to ensure your team is fully independent.

pricing.note: All prices are indicative and depend on scope, timeline, and complexity. Let's talk about your specific situation.
